intro: Crotonogyne caterviflora, commonly known as the clustered-flowered croton, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with distinctive floral structures. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
